episodeTitle: Navy Headquarters Admiral Aokiji! The Ferocity of an Ultimate Powerhouse!
episodeTitleJapanese: 海軍本部大将青キジ！最高戦力の脅威
episodeTitleRomanized: Kaigun honbu taishō Aokiji! Saikō senryoku no kyōi
description: The Straw Hat crew encounters Marine Admiral Aokiji at Long Ring Long Land. Despite his lazy demeanor, Aokiji demonstrates terrifying ice powers and reveals his connection to Nico Robin's past, leaving the crew helpless against one of the World Government's strongest warriors.

events.title: Admiral Aokiji's Debut
events.description: Marine Admiral Aokiji (Kuzan) makes his first appearance in the anime, appearing before the Straw Hat Pirates at Long Ring Long Land. His lazy demeanor contrasts sharply with his title as one of the World Government's three greatest military powers.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most powerful characters in the One Piece world and sets the stage for understanding the true strength gap between the Straw Hats and the World Government's top fighters.

quotes.text: I'm just out for a walk.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji casually explains his presence despite being a Marine Admiral

events.title: Ice Age - Aokiji Freezes the Ocean
events.description: Aokiji demonstrates his Devil Fruit power for the first time by using Ice Age, placing his hand in the water and instantly freezing a massive section of the ocean along with a Sea King. This allows stranded people to cross the frozen sea to safety.
events.significance: First display of the Hie Hie no Mi's incredible power and scale, showing the vast difference in ability between an Admiral and typical Devil Fruit users. Demonstrates Aokiji's seemingly benevolent nature.

quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji calmly announces his technique while freezing the ocean

events.title: The Three Admirals Revealed
events.description: Robin reveals to the crew that Aokiji is one of the three Marine Admirals - Aokiji, Akainu, and Kizaru - who represent the World Government's greatest military strength. Their silhouettes are shown as she explains their significance.
events.significance: First mention of all three Admirals by name in the anime, establishing the highest tier of Marine power that the Straw Hats will eventually face. Sets up future conflicts with these legendary fighters.

quotes.text: The three Admirals: Akainu, Aokiji, and Kizaru. They are the World Government's three greatest powers.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin warns the crew about Aokiji's true position and power

events.title: Aokiji's Connection to Robin's Past
events.description: Robin panics upon recognizing Aokiji, revealing their dark history connected to the Ohara incident 20 years ago. Her unusual fear makes it clear that Aokiji represents a specific threat to her survival.
events.significance: Establishes the personal connection between Aokiji and Robin, foreshadowing the revelation of Robin's tragic past and the Ohara incident. This is the first time the crew sees Robin truly frightened.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin's panicked reaction to seeing Aokiji, showing uncharacteristic fear

events.title: Aokiji Reveals His Target: Nico Robin
events.description: Aokiji states he came specifically to see Robin and warns that her presence makes the Straw Hat crew particularly dangerous, noting their combined bounty of 239,000,000 Belly.
events.significance: Reveals that the World Government continues to track Robin, foreshadowing the CP9 arc and the threat she poses to the World Government due to her ability to read Poneglyphs.

quotes.text: What makes your crew dangerous is Nico Robin. I should kill you all right here.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji explains why he's there and the threat Robin poses

events.title: Robin Uses Treinta Fleur: Clutch on Aokiji
events.description: In a desperate attempt to protect herself and the crew, Robin uses her Treinta Fleur: Clutch technique, sprouting thirty arms to grab Aokiji and snap his body. Aokiji shatters like ice, shocking the crew, but then reforms completely unharmed.
events.significance: Demonstrates both Robin's advanced Hana Hana no Mi techniques and the futility of fighting a Logia-type Devil Fruit user without Haki. Shows the crew's powerlessness against top-tier opponents.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin attempts to break Aokiji's body with her Devil Fruit power

events.title: Aokiji Creates Ice Saber
events.description: Aokiji creates an Ice Saber by freezing blades of grass with his breath, forming a weapon to attack Robin. Zoro intercepts the blade and Sanji kicks it from Aokiji's hand, showing the Monster Trio working together.
events.significance: Introduces Aokiji's Ice Saber technique and demonstrates the creativity of his ice powers. Shows the crew's willingness to protect Robin despite the overwhelming power difference.

events.title: The Monster Trio Attacks Aokiji
events.description: Luffy attacks with Gomu Gomu no Pistol, but before the attack connects, Aokiji grabs both Zoro's arm and Sanji's leg. He then uses his ice powers to freeze his own body along with Luffy's fist, Zoro's arm, and Sanji's leg, immobilizing all three fighters simultaneously.
events.significance: Demonstrates the vast power gap between the Straw Hats' strongest fighters and a Marine Admiral. This is one of the first times Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji are completely outmatched.

events.title: Aokiji Mentions Luffy's Grandfather
events.description: Aokiji stares at Luffy and comments that he's the spitting image of his grandfather, mentioning that long ago, his grandfather caused a lot of trouble for him. This is the first mention of Luffy having a grandfather in the series.
events.significance: First foreshadowing of Monkey D. Garp's existence and his connection to both Luffy and Aokiji. Sets up one of the series' major reveals about Luffy's family lineage and Garp's legendary status.

quotes.text: You're the spitting image of your grandpa. Long ago, he caused a lot of trouble for me.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji's first mention of Luffy's grandfather

events.title: Aokiji Freezes Robin with Ice Time
events.description: Despite Nami's pleas for Robin to run, Robin stands her ground trying to tell Aokiji she's changed. Before she can finish, Aokiji grabs her in a bear hug and uses his Ice Time technique, freezing his body and Robin along with it. The crew watches in horror as Robin is completely frozen.
events.significance: The cliffhanger ending that shows Aokiji's ruthlessness and sets up the next episode's dramatic rescue. Demonstrates that Robin cannot escape her past and foreshadows the Water 7/Enies Lobby arc conflict.

quotes.text: I'm no longer the same as I was before!
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin's desperate plea before being frozen

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami's frantic warning as Aokiji approaches Robin

quotes.text: I'm just out for a walk.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji's casual explanation of his presence

quotes.text: The three Admirals: Akainu, Aokiji, and Kizaru. They are the World Government's three greatest powers.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin explains the significance of the Marine Admirals

quotes.text: What makes your crew dangerous is Nico Robin.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Aokiji reveals why he's targeting the Straw Hats

quotes.text: You're the spitting image of your grandpa. Long ago, he caused a lot of trouble for me.
quotes.speaker: Aokiji

quotes.text: I'm no longer the same as I was before!
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin's desperate plea before being frozen

themes.description: The episode starkly demonstrates the vast gap between the Straw Hats and the World Government's top fighters, showing that despite their victories so far, they are still far from being able to challenge the true powers of the world.
themes.symbolism: The frozen ocean represents the absolute control Aokiji has over the situation, just as he freezes the Straw Hats' strongest fighters with ease.

themes.description: Robin's reaction to Aokiji shows that no matter how far she runs or how much she changes, her past continues to haunt her. This foreshadows the Water 7 arc's central conflict.
themes.symbolism: Robin being frozen represents her inability to escape from her past and the World Government's continued pursuit.

themes.description: Aokiji's contradiction between his lazy demeanor and his role as an Admiral introduces his personal philosophy of 'Lazy Justice,' contrasting with the absolute justice other Marines pursue.
themes.symbolism: Aokiji's casual 'walk' belies the serious threat he represents.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as one of the World Government's three Admirals. Shows his immense power, lazy personality, and complex morality. Reveals connections to both Robin's past and Luffy's grandfather.
keyActions: Freezes the ocean with Ice Age
Reveals his mission to find Robin
Freezes Luffy, Zoro, and Sanji simultaneously
quotes: I'm just out for a walk.
What makes your crew dangerous is Nico Robin.
You're the spitting image of your grandpa.

characterSpotlights.development: For the first time, Robin shows genuine fear and panic. Her past catches up with her as Aokiji represents the World Government force that destroyed her homeland. She tries to fight and assert she's changed, but is ultimately frozen.
keyActions: Reveals the three Admirals to the crew
Attacks Aokiji with Treinta Fleur: Clutch
quotes: The three Admirals: Akainu, Aokiji, and Kizaru.
I'm no longer the same as I was before!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces one of his first truly hopeless battles. Despite his determination to protect Robin, he is easily defeated and learns there are enemies far beyond his current strength.
keyActions: Attacks Aokiji with Gomu Gomu no Pistol
Reacts with shock to mention of his grandfather
Watches helplessly as Robin is frozen

mangaDifferences.difference: The entire Foxy's Return Arc (episodes 225-228) is anime filler. In the manga, Aokiji encounters the Straw Hats directly at Tonjit's location after the Davy Back Fight, not on a separate adventure.
The anime extends the encounter and adds more dialogue and reaction shots compared to the manga's more concise presentation.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Admiral Aokiji in the anime and the first time all three original Admirals (Aokiji, Akainu, Kizaru) are mentioned by name.
Aokiji's voice actor Takehito Koyasu also voices Dio Brando in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure, another character associated with freezing abilities.
This is the first mention of Luffy having a grandfather in the One Piece anime, foreshadowing the reveal of Monkey D. Garp.

sources.title: One Piece: Who Is Luffy's Grandfather?

trivia.fact: The episode achieved a TV rating of 10.4%, ranking 4th for the week it aired in Japan.
Episode 227 is based on chapters 319 and 320 of the manga, though it occurs in a different context due to the anime-original Foxy's Return Arc.
